item.title: KPN CloudFAQ
item.description: To solve servicedesk fatique, I’ve launched an Automated Dashboard for agents to improve chat performance for KPN Cloud Competence Center; made by co-creation and objects hyperlinking…

item.title: Plantenbiebs Nederland
item.description: I wish to contribute to society by co-creating progressive web apps to stimulate local plant exchange in the Benelux. I’ve made some friends who each runs a plantenbieb in their area succesfully…

item.title: Suberdeal
item.description: PHP code are considered bad practices due to inherent security problems, while it runs 80% of e-commerce of the world. The shopaholic in me started researching by hands-on study on Object Orientated vs Object Distributed architecture…

item.title: NIZ Micro 82 EC
item.description: For portability and design reasons, Apple is promoting it’s chiclet agenda; by narrowing the key travel on it’s keyboards. This takes away the critical margin for pleasure in touch typing…

item.title: vim
item.description: My favourite command line text editor and why Microsoft 365 Word is not sufficient for word processing…

item.title: GPD Pocket P2
item.description: A legendary pocket computer launched in 2018. I got to keep this review device for participation in the Linux Hardware Tweak Programme in Shenzhen…

item.title: ranger
item.description: When you need to visually fly through systemdir from the command line, there is only one tool to do it classy…

item.title: URxvt daemon
item.description: There are three in my toolset but just one is mandatory. URxvt is the most memory efficient terminal emulator when run as a daemon…

item.title: X61 Linux install
item.description: My system on Thinkpad X61 is build from the ground up. I’ve took notes while installing Void Linux with chroot to show the installation steps. It’s basically the void-installer script done manually…
